page.title: 14Merdon Manor (5)
page.content: The Hursley Chimneys and Cottages ================================= At the back of Merdon Manor there are three cottages , built in 1914 . They are built of local chalk , mined at a site on the Hursley Park Estate , near to the bronze-age hill-fort of Merdon Castle . They are Grade Two Listed Buildings because of some remarkable , highly decorated , and very tall chimneys , made out of brick . These chimneys , totally out of place on the humble workers' cottages , are known as the "Hursley Chimneys" . They are unique to Hursley . The cottages are covered with their original thatch , now 71 years old , but this is going to be stripped late in 1985 , and early in 1986 . The cottages belong to workers on Merdon Manor and the Hursley Park Estate .
